layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: The state or fact of having a duty to deal with something; owning what is yours to handle without blame-shifting or victimhood.

questions.text: I own my choices — I don't blame circumstances, other people, or my past for what I decide to do.
When I fail to follow through on something, I take responsibility rather than pointing to obstacles or interference.
questions.principle: No excuses for lack of execution

questions.text: I recognize that my life outcomes are largely the result of my accumulated choices, not fate or luck.
I refuse to see myself as a victim of circumstances beyond my control — I always have choices in how I respond.
I own that procrastination and avoidance are my choices, not things that 'happen to me.'
